headline: Why This Analyst Just Shorted the S&P
summary: CPI comes in relatively good – does it matter? … Q1 earnings have been strong, but Louis Navellier is beating them … Walgreens doubles down on robots … Jeff Clark says it’s time to bet against this rally The release of the latest Consumer Price Index (CPI) Report this morning showed that prices cooled more than expected in April. Month-to-month headline prices rose 0.2%, putting the yearly rate at 2.3% – its lowest reading since February 2021. Forecasts had called for 0.2% and 2.4%, respectively
